intro: Plectrotropis hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy plectrotropis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green to yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
